p: Cheese samples expel moisture, particularly at the beginning of ripening, leading to bacterial growth. However, the overall moisture of Gouda cheese decreases steadily during ripening, which avoids bacterial growth. Besides, some microorganisms such as coliforms grow as long as lactose, or citrate, is present (Fox, McSweeney, Cogan, & Guinee, 2004; Jo, Benoist, Ameerally, & Drake, 2018).
